text: this is what people look like in Western
Europe and Britain ten thousand years
ago not what we would have expected I'm
Christina and I'm research leader in
human origins at the Natural History
Museum in London
and I'm holding here this wonderful
reconstructed head of cheddar man and
I've been studying the skeleton of
cheddar man for some forty years or so
and now with DNA technology we've got
the whole genome a cheddar man and here
we've got a scientific reconstruction of
what he look like we've got his hair
form his skin his blue eyes and that
type skin color that combination really
striking and getting out of here
information about his biology the fact
that for example he couldn't digest milk
because that came in with the advent of
farming after the time of cheddar man so
we're getting his whole biology how he
relates to people in Europe at the time
and how he relates to people in Britain
[Music]
